head.title: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord

hedline.hl1: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord

abstract.p: Scott Miller letter sees chilling precedent in Supreme Court ruling that Boy Scouts organization has right to dismiss gay troop leader (S)

block.p: Re ''Supreme Court Backs Boy Scouts in Ban of Gays From Membership'' (front page, June 29):
Re ''Supreme Court Backs Boy Scouts in Ban of Gays From Membership'' (front page, June 29):

In upholding the right of the Boy Scouts of America to discriminate against exemplary gay Americans, the Supreme Court has created a chilling precedent that will now allow other organizations to discriminate freely against anyone they choose.

Since this is the final legal word on the issue, we must accept it. But if the Boy Scouts are adamant about continuing their discrimination, they should no longer be allowed to hold meetings in public schools or be associated with local police or fire departments. Apparently, it's acceptable for the Boy Scouts to discriminate, but it is still unacceptable for the government to endorse such discrimination.
